349.article_body: The Taiwanese Ministry of National Defense has begun to "immediately prepare for war" and has put the military on high alert, local news outlets reported. This comes amid repeated Chinese warnings of military action over the reported upcoming visit of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Taiwan is reportedly preparing air-raid shelters for citizens and has cancelled soldiers' and officers' leaves.

350.title: Delhi HC quashes Arms Act FIR against man, tells him to give sanitisers to students
350.article_body: Delhi High Court quashed an FIR against a US resident who was found with a live bullet at the Indira Gandhi International Airport. The man had claimed that his uncle used a licensed weapon during celebratory firing at Diwali and a cartridge remained in his pocket. The court directed him to distribute mosquito repellents and hand sanitisers to school students.

351.title: 4 doctors, a manager booked for negligence after fire kills 8 at MP hospital
351.article_body: Four doctors and a manager were booked for negligence after a fire broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur and killed eight people. The doctors are absconding, while the manager has been arrested, police said. "If government officials are found involved for giving permissions overlooking lapses, a case will be registered against them," SP Siddharth Bahuguna said.

352.title: Musk sued by Twitter investor with 5,500 shares over $44 bn buyout deal
352.article_body: A Twitter investor holding 5,500 shares has sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk with proposed class action and has named two "corporate acquisition entities" related to the deal as defendants apart from Musk. The shareholder seeks a court order compelling Musk to go through with his $44 billion deal. The new suit targets Musk's "lame rationales for reneging on his contract".

353.title: Twitter banned 43,140 Indian users in June for violating guidelines
353.article_body: Twitter banned 43,140 accounts of Indian users in June 2022 over violation of its guidelines, according to Twitter's July 2022 compliance report. Twitter removed 40,982 accounts for child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity and similar content, while 2,158 accounts were banned for promoting terrorism. Twitter's local grievance mechanism received 724 grievances between May 26 and June 25.

354.title: ED investigates GST number linked to Arpita Mukherjee
354.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a GST number linked to former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee’s close aide Arpita Mukherjee in connection to the SSC scam. "She used one GST number for running a beauty parlour business. We are trying to find out whether this one was generated in an illegal manner to evade taxes," an ED official said.

355.title: Cabinet rejig is to divert attention: BJP Bengal Chief
355.article_body: BJP Bengal chief Sukanta Majumdar on Monday took a potshot at CM Mamata Banerjee over Cabinet reshuffle. “Banerjee is taking such decisions to divert the media’s attention from the corruption cases,” said Majumdar while referring to the arrest of former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. Earlier, Mamata had announced to reshuffle the Cabinet.

356.title: CM Shinde cancels garden inauguration in Pune after controversy over name
356.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde cancelled a garden inauguration programme in Pune after controversy erupted over reports that the garden was developed on public land and named after him. "We have cancelled the inauguration. We will put up a proposal with the name of the garden to Pune Municipal Corporation's garden committee for further decision," Shinde supporter Nana Bhangire said.

357.title: BJP, Cong workers clash in Tripura's Charilam; Section 144 imposed
357.article_body: CrPC Section 144 was imposed in Tripura's Charilam after a clash broke out between the workers of BJP and Congress. The police said that a group of BJP workers tried to provoke people during a political event organised by the Congress, after which they resorted to lathi charge. Meanwhile, Deputy CM Jishnu Dev Varma blamed the Congress for triggering violence.

358.title: Peacock wrapped in Tiranga after death in UP's Ghaziabad, video surfaces
358.article_body: A peacock was wrapped in Tiranga after it passed away in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. A video that surfaced online showed police personnel carrying the body of the peacock, wrapped in India's national flag, on a stretcher. According to reports, a Twitter user mentioned that the peacock was found dead at the Kaushambi metro station of the region.

359.title: Bengaluru likely to witness heavy rainfall today, tomorrow: IMD
359.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that urban areas in Bengaluru are likely to witness heavy rainfall today and tomorrow. This comes after heavy showers in the city on Monday evening left several areas inundated. While power outages were reported in BTM and HSR Layout, water entered houses in Yelahanka, Yelachenahalli and some regions in north Bengaluru, reports said.

360.title: Biden says he's ready for nuclear deal with Russia as UN talks begin
360.article_body: US President Joe Biden said he is ready for new nuclear arms deal with Russia, calling upon Russian President Vladimir Putin to act in good faith. In a written statement to NPT review conference, Putin said that there will be no winners in a nuclear war. Putin had put nuclear arms on high alert days after Russian invasion of Ukraine.

361.title: Nuclear annihilation just one miscalculation away, warns UN chief
361.article_body: The world is "just one misunderstanding, one miscalculation away from nuclear annihilation", UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said while speaking at the opening of a Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty conference. The conference is taking place "at a time of nuclear danger not seen since the height of the Cold War", he added, citing Russia-Ukraine war and "many other factors around the world".

362.title: Container truck carrying chemical overturns on Ghodbunder Road in Thane
362.article_body: A container truck transporting tanks of hydrogen peroxide chemical overturned on the busy Ghodbunder Road in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. The gas from the container leaked on the road, emitting a foul odour. The accident resulted in a huge traffic jam, officials said. "There are no cases of anyone affected due to the chemical leak," an official said.

363.title: Has any BJP leader faced CBI, ED action: NCP youth wing poster in Aurangabad
363.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party's youth wing has put up banners in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, asking if any leader from the Bharatiya Janata Party has ever faced CBI or ED action. The poster that has NYC state secretary Akshay Patil's picture and contact details, also asked if any agency continued its probe against a leader after they switched over to the BJP.

364.title: 1.6 million coca leaf bushes seized in Honduras
364.article_body: Honduran authorities seized more than 1.6 million coca leaf bushes on Monday. Officials said that the bushes, used to make cocaine, were located in mountainous areas in the coastal department of Colon after a three-day operation. According to security forces statistics, total 2,625,015 bushes have been seized this year, significantly up from 531,826 bushes seized in 2021.

365.title: WI's Obed McCoy dedicates 'Man of the Match' award vs India to his mother
365.article_body: West Indies pacer Obed McCoy, who broke the record for best-ever T20I bowling figures against India in the second T20I on Monday, dedicated his 'Man of the Match' award to his mother. "She is sick and she has motivated me to be a better player," said McCoy at the post-match presentation. McCoy registered figures of 4-1-17-6 in the match.

366.title: Ex-K'taka minister's employee steals valuables from his B'luru home, arrested
366.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested an employee of former Karnataka Home Minister MB Patil for allegedly stealing foreign currency and valuables from his house in Bengaluru's Sadashivanagar. The accused, Jayanth Kumar, is a native of Odisha. Kumar used to work as a laundryman at Patil's home, police said, adding that he gifted the stolen watches to his friends in Odisha.

367.title: Goa CM urges citizens to join ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign
367.article_body: Ahead of the country's 75th Independence Day celebrations, Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant urged people to participate in the ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign and hoist the tricolour flag at their houses from August 13 to 16. “I urge Goans to keep the national flag as their display picture on social media from August 2 onwards,” Sawant said.

368.title: Polio was in NYC wastewater a month before case was detected: Official
368.article_body: New York health officials said that polio virus was present in wastewater of New York City suburb a month before health officials confirmed a case last month. In an emailed statement, US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said there may be more people shedding the virus in their stool. Officials urged residents to be sure they are vaccinated.

369.title: Went wicketless after Murali wished me luck: Nilesh on 1997 Test vs SL
369.article_body: Recalling a Test match against Sri Lanka in 1997, ex-India spinner Nilesh Kulkarni said he got a wicket off his first ball in the match, but couldn't take a wicket in the game after that. "I'd met Muttiah Muralitharan...[after the day's play], he said '...Good luck for...next three days'. Little did I realise...I wouldn't pick a wicket," added Nilesh.

370.title: Storms hit Kentucky's flooded areas, curfews imposed due to looting
370.article_body: Disaster-hit areas in eastern Kentucky witnessed another round of storms on Monday. Death toll due to floods rose to 37 on Tuesday. According to Governor, rescue operations continue at a time when hundreds of people remain unaccounted for. Authorities declared county-wide nighttime curfews amidst looting reports in Breathitt County and Hindman in Knott County, which are devastated due to floods.

371.title: Go First car goes under IndiGo plane, narrowly avoiding collision at Delhi airport
371.article_body: A car belonging to Go First airline went under an IndiGo aircraft at Delhi airport on Tuesday, narrowly avoiding collision with the plane's nose wheel. The aircraft was readying to depart for Dhaka when the incident took place. A video of the incident has also surfaced on social media. According to officials, the DGCA will investigate the incident.

372.title: Whenever you do 'Koffee...' someone cries: Aamir Khan to Karan Johar
372.article_body: During his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7' which is hosted by filmmaker Karan Johar, actor Aamir Khan said, "Whenever you do your show, someone...cries." Aamir was accompanied by actress Kareena Kapoor. Responding to a question about the thing she tolerates about Aamir, Kareena stated him taking 100-200 days for shooting a film, which Akshay Kumar does in 30 days.

373.title: I really have to work on my phrasing: Brad Pitt on retirement claim
373.article_body: On being asked about his statement of being in the "last semester or trimester" of his career, actor Brad Pitt said that he really has to work on his phrasing. "I was just saying I'm past middle age and I want to be specific about how I spend those last things however they may be," the actor added.

374.title: Arshdeep has bowled tough overs for PBKS, that's why he was confident vs WI: Parthiv
374.article_body: Talking about pacer Arshdeep Singh, ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel said the 23-year-old was "confident" in his bowling in the second T20I against West Indies on Monday. "Arshdeep has been bowling those tough overs [for PBKS], that's the reason why you could see the confidence in him," added Parthiv. Arshdeep registered figures of 1/26 off his four overs in the game.

375.title: DDA's cash deficit due to unsold housing inventory of ₹18,000 cr: Govt
375.article_body: Delhi Development Authority's cash deficit of ₹9,615 crore is primarily due to unsold housing inventory worth around ₹18,000 crore, Housing and Urban Affairs Minister of State, Kaushal Kishore, informed the Rajya Sabha. The housing stock is lying unsold since 2014 as small flats located in the Narela area are deemed to be too costly and lack Metro connectivity, Kishore stated.

376.title: 10 villa owners booked for illegal rentals in Pune's Lonavala
376.article_body: Pune's Lonavala police have booked 10 villa owners between July 29 and July 31 for allegedly illegally renting their properties to tourists. The city's municipal council also urged owners to not rent villas without checking safety measures. "Our drive has intensified after...two recent deaths. Owners should either get requisite licence or stop renting villas and bungalows," an inspector said.

377.title: Terrorists hurl grenade at police post in J&K's Ramban
377.article_body: Terrorists hurled a grenade at a police post in the Gool area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district on Tuesday, said officials. The grenade exploded on the roof of the police post, however, no injuries were reported. Jammu Kashmir Ghaznavi Force (JKGF), an offshoot of Lashkar-e-Taiba, has claimed responsibility for the attack in a letter, said ADGP Mukesh Singh.

378.title: California declares state of emergency over monkeypox outbreak
378.article_body: California has declared a state of emergency due to the spread of monkeypox in a bid to escalate efforts to combat the outbreak. Emergency medical officials will be allowed to administer monkeypox vaccines approved by the federal government. Last week, the state expanded its testing capacity to carry out more than 1,000 tests a week.

379.title: Russian action at Ukraine's nuclear plant risks terrible accident: US
379.article_body: The US has accused Russia of using Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant as a 'nuclear shield' and risking a terrible nuclear accident. US said that Russia has stationed troops near Zaporizhzhia plant, Ukraine's biggest nuclear power plant, and preventing Ukrainian forces from returning fire. In March, Russia was accused of firing shells dangerously close to the nuclear power plant.

380.title: US might control export of its chipmaking equipment to China: Report
380.article_body: US might limit shipment of American chipmaking equipment to Chinese memory chip makers with an aim to stop China's semiconductor sector advances, reports said. US might ban the export of tools to China used to make NAND chips. If amended, this would be first US step to target China's production of memory chips without specialised military apps through export controls.

381.title: Arvind Kejriwal promises free education and jobs in Gujarat
381.article_body: AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday criticised BJP over unemployment and hooch tragedies in Gujarat. "I appeal to the people to choose AAP if you want free quality education and employment for your youth. You may vote for the BJP if you wish to feed them spurious liquor," said Kejriwal. He also promised unemployment allowance if AAP wins the polls.

382.title: Reduce fossil fuel use, adopt green energy for public transport: Gadkari
382.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari stressed on the need to reduce fossil fuel consumption and adopt green energy for public transport and said the fare in electric buses can be 30% less than diesel ones. "Need to change country's transport system...Instead of petrol and diesel, we should focus on cheaper options like electricity, green hydrogen, ethanol and Bio-CNG," Gadkari added.

383.title: ED searches newspaper head office in Delhi in National Herald case
383.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday conducted searches at multiple places, including Herald House on Delhi's Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, reports said. The searches were conducted in connection with ED's probe into the National Herald case under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). Searches were conducted days after Congress President Sonia Gandhi was questioned in case.

384.title: Law student stabs classmate over love triangle in Lucknow university
384.article_body: A law student stabbed his classmate multiple times with a machete over an alleged love triangle at a private university in Lucknow. The victim suffered injuries around his neck, head and hands and has undergone multiple surgeries. The victim and accused had a fight a few days ago over a girl in their class. The accused is in custody.

385.title: Delhi's 1st monkeypox patient discharged: LNJP Hospital MD
385.article_body: Delhi's first monkeypox patient has been successfully discharged, Suresh Kumar, the Medical Director (MD) of the national capital's LNJP Hospital, said on Tuesday. He added that the man, who had no history of foreign travel, recovered in 25 days as "all symptoms waned away". This comes a day after a second monkeypox case was reported in Delhi.

386.title: Productivity at Google is not where it needs to be, there are real concerns: CEO
386.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai at a recent all-hands meeting said, "There are real concerns that our productivity...is not where it needs to be for the headcount we have." Pichai asked employees to help "create a culture that is more mission-focused", CNBC reported. "We should think about how we can minimise distractions and really raise the bar on...productivity," he added.

387.title: Afghanistan needs India's help desperately: Taliban
387.article_body: Taliban militant Sirajuddin Haqqani said that Afghanistan "desperately" needs India's help, adding that India has a name in technology and trust in the international community that it fulfils its promises. "India has historical ties with Afghanistan. India had started some research and developmental programmes in Afghanistan...We want the unfinished projects...be...completed," he added.

388.title: We should be little kind to Hindi films: Alia on North vs South debate
388.article_body: Reacting to the North vs South debate, actress Alia Bhatt has said that it has been a tough year for Indian cinema. "We should be a little kind to Hindi films...Even in the South industry, all their films have not worked [this year]," she added. Alia further stated that a film with good content "always" does well.

389.title: Beyoncé to remove ableist lyric from new song 'Heated' amid backlash
389.article_body: Singer-songwriter Beyoncé has confirmed that she will change the lyrics of her new song 'Heated' which were called ableist and offensive by disability activists. The lyrics, co-written by Canadian singer Drake, have the line, "Spazzin' on that a**, spazz on that a**." "The word, not used intentionally in a harmful way, will be replaced," her statement read.

390.title: SC imposes ₹5 lakh fine on NGO over Noida's twin towers' petition
390.article_body: The Supreme Court asked an NGO to pay ₹5 lakh fine for filing a PIL seeking alteration of its year-old judgement directing demolition of Supertech twin towers in Noida Sector 93A. The petition urged court to utilise the 40-storey towers for some "national cause" instead of demolishing. The court asked the petitioner to deposit the amount within four weeks.

391.title: Water supply in parts of Pune to be shut off on Thursday
391.article_body: The water supply in parts of Pune will remain shut off on Thursday due to maintenance and repair work at the Parvati and Lashkar water stations. The water supply on Friday will be low pressure and delayed, Pune Municipal Corporation officials said. The areas which will get affected include Dattawadi, Rajendra Nagar, Mula Road, Koregaon Park, Wanawadi and others.

392.title: K'taka HC issues notices to Centre, state over detention of Sri Lankan citizens
392.article_body: Karnataka High Court has issued notices to the union and state governments over the alleged detention of Sri Lankan citizens in Bangalore Central Jail in Parappana Agrahara. A PIL has been filed on behalf of 25 persons claiming that the detention is illegal and a violation of human rights. It also seeks the transfer of the accused to detention centres.

393.title: Russia seeks to ban 'unfriendly' nations from adopting Russian children
393.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Monday tabled a bill in the lower house of the Parliament to ban the adoption of Russian children by citizens of "unfriendly" countries. If passed, the bill would expand a 2012 law that prohibits US citizens from adopting Russian children. Russia's list of unfriendly countries was expanded after several nations imposed sanctions on Moscow over Ukraine invasion.

394.title: Circulation of fake ₹2,000 notes decreased in banking system from 2018-19: Govt
394.article_body: The Union Ministry of Finance told Lok Sabha that circulation of fake ₹2,000 denomination currency notes has decreased in banking system from 2018-19. "In 2021-22, the number of fake currency notes of ₹2,000 denomination detected in banking system was 13,604 pieces which is 0.000635% of total number of banknotes of ₹2,000 denomination in circulation," MoS for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said.

395.title: Another monkeypox case reported in Kerala, India's tally reaches 7
395.article_body: Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Tuesday informed that another monkeypox case was reported in the state, making it the fifth case in the state and seventh in India. The patient is a 30-year-old man who reached Kozhikode airport from UAE on July 27 and is currently undergoing treatment in Malappuram. Other two cases of monkeypox were reported in Delhi.

396.title: 2 women try to sell newborn girl for ₹4.5 lakh in Mumbai; arrested
396.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her associate were arrested for allegedly trying to sell a 15-day-old baby girl for ₹4.5 lakh in Mumbai. A member of Central Adoption Resources Authority received a tip-off about a woman who was looking for a buyer for the baby. He along with police tricked her into selling the babygirl to him and caught her red-handed.

397.title: Oil extends losses amid global demand concerns, manufacturing data
397.article_body: Oil prices on Tuesday extended the losses from the previous session with Brent crude futures falling 29 cents to $99.74 a barrel and WTI crude futures down 22 cents at $93.67 a barrel. The slide was driven by global oil demand concerns after weak manufacturing data in several countries. The Brent futures settled at $100.03 a barrel on Monday.

398.title: Murder accused ex-Army man, who acted in 28 films while hiding for 30 years, held
398.article_body: A murder accused, identified as Omprakash alias Pasha who earlier worked in the Indian Army's Signals Corps, has been arrested after 30 years. Pasha and his partner were booked in 1992 for allegedly stabbing to death a motorcyclist during a looting bid in Haryana. After the murder, Pasha started doing odd jobs, including acting in 28 regional and Bhojpuri films.

399.title: Maruti Suzuki India reports 8.2% increase in sales in July
399.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India on Monday reported an increase of 8.28% in total sales to 1,75,916 units in July 2022 against 1,62,462 units in the corresponding period last fiscal. Domestic passenger vehicle sales rose by 6.82% to 1,42,850 units, the carmaker said, adding that the shortage of electronic components had a slight impact on the production of vehicles.

400.title: 'Tiranga bike rally' for all MPs to be oraganised in Delhi tomorrow
400.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said on Tuesday that the Culture Ministry is organising a 'Tiranga bike rally' for MPs of all political parties from Red Fort to the Parliament in Delhi tomorrow. He also urged all the MPs to join the rally at 8.30 am and stressed that the rally was organised by the ministry and not the BJP.
